headline: If You Bought 1 Share of Palo Alto at Its IPO, Here's How Many Shares You Would Own Now
summary: Palo Alto Networks (NASDAQ: PANW) may be recognized in the marketplace as a leader in cybersecurity solutions, but investors may be more familiar with the company after it completed a stock split in early December.  As computer networking has become increasingly present in our daily lives, Palo Alto, a company committed to keep users and their data safe, has seen its stock skyrocket in value.  A $10,000 investment back in July 2012 when the company held its initial public offering would now be worth north of $692,000.
